fields.summary: Add "&os_authType=basic" to the RSS feeds links in JIRA by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14442].
  {panel}

Scenario:
1. In browser's window (call it "Tab1") create a search to Find some issues....  - OR - open a saved filter.  (call this result "Filter1")
2. Do some important manipulation of Filter1, such as sort by Assignee.
3. Decide that then you want to cross reference another filter, or search for another specific issue, thus:
4. Open a new browser window/tab (call it "Tab2").   Run another search... - OR - open a different saved filter.  (call this result "Filter2")
5. Return to Tab1's original search results (Filter1) and attempt to manipulate it further, such as sort by a column, or click to next search result page.
6. Observe:  The resulting display in Tab1 executes against Filter2.  Your view of Filter1 is irretreviably lost.

Thus you can only ever engage with one 'active' filter in a browser session.  Using 2+ filters simultaneously (even if Saved Filters) are not supported.  

We cull so frequently and complexly from the data in our jira project, that this is a huge drawback.
fields.summary: Support more than one 'active'/simultaneous Issue filter in a session

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14441].
  {panel}

It is often necessary to copy-paste jira issue title to emails or other documents, it should contain both ID(with link) and summary.
For example:
[JRA-1] Handy issue title (id + summary)

Currently you need to go and copy-paste summary and then copy-paste ID with link.

It would be nice to copy-paste these fields with one step by either adding ID link (with tiny font for example) in front of summary or using some action like "Copy summary to clipboard"
fields.summary: Handy issue title (id + summary)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14437].
  {panel}

Hi , I have one request can we have a filter for Start and End Date on the main Time Tracking Report page so that in case I want to see task status for some particular period tasks or the due date lies between 2 dates.

Actually we have monthly builds and I need to see the task status for every month ,

Also if you could add Due date column in the output of the report against every task as displayed in the output.

It would be even great if we get an option in the 1st screen to hide tasks with no due date, in the output report

Thanks

Amit
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report - to include Date filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14434].
  {panel}

Hi

Can you add an improvement so a user is allowed to create an items in jira but is not allowed to clone items. ie removing the clone button from certain groups.

JSP-19870

Kind Regards

Scott
fields.summary: Removing Clone button from certain groups - add Clone Issue permission

fields.description:
One thing that has bothered me is that long fields values force the columns to be wider. This is incredibly annoying. The columns should be resizable.

To show that this can be done I have written a GM script.
http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/18819

You will need GreaseMonkey and Firefox to use it.
fields.summary: Resizable columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14424].
  {panel}

The "Browse projects" permission mixes up two different things: (1) permission to see a project at all, (2) permission to see project issues. These two capabilities should have distinct permissions. The current mixup drastically reduces the usefulness of granting permissions to "Reporter" and "Current assignee". A distinct "View project" permission should be required before any other permission is considered. The current "Browse projects" permission could be renamed to "Browse issues".

Currently if you grant "Browse project" to "Reporter", ALL users can see ALL projects, even those where they have no role. Of course you can create a permission scheme per project, but that nullifies the whole point of having permission schemes.

This subject has been extensively discussed previously (JRA-4093, JRA-4935, JRA-8950, JRA-11881, JRA-14307). A fix is identified in JRA-14307. It's great to have a patch, but much better to solve the underlying problem.


*Workaround* 
This might help in some cases : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Current+Reporter+Browse+Project+Permission.
fields.summary: Separate permissions for issue filtering and project display
RegexCommentHandler with IMAP not just POP
JIRA should have separate permission for ManageTrackback

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14398].
  {panel}

From Customer:

The suggested changes in server.xml differ on two sites:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Datasource+for+Oracle+10g+JDBC+drivers

{code:xml}
<Context path="/jira" docBase="path/to/atlassian-jira-3.11.war">
<Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
username="...."
password="...."
driverClassName="oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver"
url="jdbc:oracle:thin:@<database host machine>:<port>:<SID>"
connectionProperties="SetBigStringTryClob=true" />
<Resource name="UserTransaction" auth="Container" type="javax.transaction.UserTransaction"
factory="org.objectweb.jotm.UserTransactionFactory"
jotm.timeout="60"/>
<Manager className="org.apache.catalina.session.PersistentManager" saveOnRestart="false"/>
</Context>
{code}

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/oracle.html
{code:xml}
<Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
username="[enter db username]"
password="[enter db password]"
driverClassName="oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver"
url="jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:jiradb"
connectionProperties="SetBigStringTryClob=true"
maxActive="20"/>
{code}

We use the first one on our new config (10gR2) with Jira Standalone however before we used the second one:
What should we use fromm the different config's:

    * <Manager className="org.apache.catalina.session.PersistentManager" saveOnRestart="false"/>
    * maxActive="20"
fields.summary: Improve Oracle database configuration in JIRA documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14378].
  {panel}

The solution provided to JRA-8497 will not work in our case.
This is related to the 'working as designed' described in JRA-10210

We would like the clone ability to be shut off for only one project in our JIRA.  This is because when an issue is cloned, it does not automatically get assigned to the default assignee and therefore there is not an e-mail sent via our notification scheme to the appropriate persons.  We are encouraging users to re-open issues rather than clone them so they are not lost.  However, this is not working so nicely.   Is there a way to simply turn 'clone' off for a single project without affecting all projects within that instance of JIRA?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict 'Clone Issue' by PROJECT
Dashboard draws issues bar outside of project box

fields.description:
The basic requirement is to obtain issues using a filter in XML format from a backend application. Ideally I would like to configure the fields I want in my result XML


The problem is that this URL is not working, since it does not honor the user and password.
http://tracker.fuegolabs.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/12660/SearchRequest-12660.xml&os_username=USER&os_password=PASSWORD

I tried this but the redirection is wrong, it redirected to the wrong URL:
http://tracker.fuegolabs.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=12660&view=rss&os_username=USER&os_password=PASSWORD
http://tracker.fuegolabs.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?mode=hide&requestId=12660

So I would like to know what is the right way of doing this.

Thanks a lot!
MAriano
fields.summary: I cannot retrieve issues in XML format by using a filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14369].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

I would like to keep track of all the versions an issue has been scheduled in. I created a custom field for versions. I then do a bulk update at the start of the version of this field so that even if the fix version changes, I still have the original version there. However, if that same issue gets again re-scheduled, I now loose the first version that was already there if I do a bulk update. I would have to manually select both versions for that issue.

What I would like is the ability to say "add this new value to the already existing values" in a bulk change. This can be very useful to add a new label for instance to issues also.
fields.summary: Allow adding values in bulk change for multi-select custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14360].
  {panel}

Sometimes some issues grow to span several problems. This can happen very often at early stage of Jira adoption.
It would be very nice to have ability to easily split issue in two ones, without a mailstorm.
Desirable options for extracted issue:
- copy some fields/metadata, set new values to others
- move selected comments
- move selected attachments
All this should produce only one notification.
fields.summary: Split issue
Add warning about common indexing performance problems (e.g. virus protection software)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14329].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA can create a new user based on the From: field of an email, but not the CC: field.

This is related to [JRA-9983|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9983] which extends the ability to add CC: recipients on an email as watchers on an issue. This has been implemented and is scheduled for a JIRA 4.0 release, however if any of the CC: recipients are not currently users of JIRA then that recipient is silently discarded from the watcher list.

It would be useful in some circumstances that when an issue is being commented on via email, an existing user could then add a CC recipient to the email and then the JIRA handler, provided configured, could then create and then add this user via [JRA-9983|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9983], so that this new user would be able to comment and follow the progress of that issue.

However this introduces a problem of what permissions to give the new user..
fields.summary: Create users that do not exist from the CC list of e-mails
Bulk operations should read bulkEditBean.isSendBulkNotification once, not for each issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14317].
  {panel}

I think this issue should be part of resolving [\[#JRA-9941\] new notification type for "Sub-task of issue created"|JRA-9941] but if it goes faster I would really prefer to have the _standalone_ fix:

We have a notification scheme which informs every developer about new issues in a project. This is nice as it is easy to keep track of new issues or add comments if you know more about it.

*But there is a problem:* As _Issue Created_ notification also applies to Sub-Tasks the developers get a huge heap of unwanted notification mails.

This is because we use Sub-Tasks as a way a developers might organize their work to document step by step approach. Thus most of the time such sub-tasks are more like private todos than anything interesting to the public.

*I suggest* to have a separate notification called _Sub-Task created_ which is independent from _Issue created_.

If resolving JRA-9941 it might still be good to have the two notifications introduced here just in case you want to simulate the old behavior, i. e. getting Sub-Task created mails just as Sub-Task for Issue created (as proposed by JRA-9941).
fields.summary: Notifications: Separate Issue Created from (new) Sub-Task created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14314].
  {panel}

For fields with Wiki Markup, it would be useful to be able to switch the markup off for a section of text.
eg if a section contains a number of special characters, it is simpler and cleaner to turn markup off for the whole section, rather than having to escape each individual character.

Note that there already exists a tag called "noformat".
{noformat}
Unfortunately it ACTUALLY produces "preformatted" text like this.
It may be nice to deprecate this tag, and rename to "preformat".
{noformat}
Because "noformat" is not available, another suggested name would be "nowiki" or "nomarkup".

See JRA-14297 for more information.

I just saw in JRA-8175 a suggestion that wiki markup fields could act like "plain text" by default, and only switch to wiki markup if a particular tag occured to TURN IT ON.
This seems like an even better suggestion, as the user that knows about wiki is the one who turns it on. This could be a configurable option in the Wiki field, and could default to current behaviour for backward compatibility.
fields.summary: Introduce a wiki tag that says that no Wiki formatting takes place inside it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14302].
  {panel}

I would like to see following feature in JIRA such that I can use the software as our client support system.

* Ability to limit number of issues a user/group can create.

Users are given certain number of tickets based on the support contract they have in place. Once they reach the issue limit for particular level of support, they should not be able to create new issues.

* A portlet which check the number of issue available for a user/group and display it. When the user run out of allocated number of issues, ability to display a customizable message.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict number of issues a user/group can create
Remove obsolete incoming link automatically (trackback)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14299].
  {panel}

When I "MOVE" an Issue to a new project, you never get a screen asking for required changes to fields of that issues subtask.
On the confirm page you get a warning:
bq. Note: Sub-Tasks associated with this issue will lose data stored in fields not applicable in the target.

However, a Bulk Move operation works differently.
We get a step in the wizard to ask the user to change values of fields that require adjusting.

It would be nice if this was consistent.
fields.summary: The treatment of subtasks of an issue that is moved is different between (single) Move and Bulk Move.
Implement the Crowd 'requiresPasswordChange' attribute upon login.
${catalina.base}/logs/ should be the base directory for logs
Improve the custom field context create/edit UI to allow for easier management of projects and issue types for the custom field
Transfer watchers: when an issue is closed and marked as a duplicate, watchers should be automatically transfered the open linked issue
Create Issue from Email Handler - Create Username Flexibility
More customizable UI: Screens and "Core" Pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14257].
  {panel}

At present you can generate a user activity report for a single user.  It would be cool if you could enter a group, such as atlassian-developers and get a report detailing the number of issues assigned to each member of the group, grouped by project. (IE:  The current User Workload Report for each user in the group, in a long list of users).

Developer A (105 issues):
   Project A:   103 issues
   Project B:    2 issues

Developer B (230 issues);
   Project B:   200 issues
   Project C:   30 issues

etc.

Clicking on '### issues' for any user/project should take you to a a filter of the issues assigned to that user under the specific project.  Clicking on the total number of issues next to the user's name would take you to a filter of all issues assigned to that user.
fields.summary: User Workload Report by Groups
Provide option to only clone open subtasks when cloning an issue
When editing comment, user cannot see where they are typing
See history of changes made to a Version
switchable option between default boolean 'AND' and 'OR' operators in search
Stylesheet info displayed in RSS feeds in Internet Explorer 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14177].
  {panel}

Would like to be able to restrict RPC access to certain users/projects:
* Better ensure security \-having one connection less is always better :-)\- 
* Only allow some people to access the  RPC will make human errors less common. The RPC is very powerful and applications written against the RPC could do a lot of 
  'harm' in just a split second
fields.summary: Only allow Jira RPC to certain projects/users
Extend issue view and search request views to be able to produce binary content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14162].
  {panel}

this is related to http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_creation_email.html 

we have multiple projects on our server, each of which has an email address which users can send mail to and create a defect report in that project.
The problem is that createusers only creates a standard set of permissions regardless of the e-mail address the user sent to. 
(i.e. the new user is added to whatever groups are defined for Administration --> Global Permissions --> JIRA Users )

What we need is a way that a user sending to proj_A@myCompany.com is created as a member of the groups jira-users and projectA-users,
while a user sending to proj_B@myCompany.com is created as a member of the groups jira-users and projectB-users.

We need this due to the privacy concerns that some of our customers have for their products (which we develop for them).

Note that this is somewhat related to http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10364 but not exactly, since some of our customers prefer to use their personal e-mail addresses when creating accounts. 
 
While there may be cleaner ways to resolve this, one possible way occurs to me:
the developer would optionally define another handler parameter when using the createusers=true parameter. let's call is additionalgroup for the sake of example.

the ProjectA_Service would have handler.params defined similar to: .... createusers=true, additiaonalgroup=projectA-users, catchemail=proj_A@myCompany.com ....

the ProjectB_Service would have handler.params defined similar to: .... createusers=true, additiaonalgroup=projectB-users, catchemail=proj_B@myCompany.com ....

both of these services would pass their respective additionalgroup values to the service that actually creates the user in Jira.
As a result , the JIRA Users permission under Global Permissions would only include the jira-users group.
fields.summary: email service: createusers=true creates same user permissions regardless of address defect report was sent to.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14154].
  {panel}

This is Korean Partner, Goldpitcher and one of our customer requested additional excel export function.
1. Excel export with image or screenshot included in itself as object not link.
2. Excel export with attachments files included in itself as object not link.

I think this is not that easy but it is useful under offline environment.

Cheers.
fields.summary: Ability to excel export with image or file object
Change History to use renderer for fields
show previous comments transitions

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14119].

and there is nothing Language Pack for Arabic or Persian .

I think a new Plug-ins or something like that for customizitng All Application Labels . it's pretty Nice for an application such as Jira 

n.hajloo@gmail.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14096].
  {panel}

Using the wiki markup for superscript and subscript don't work inside a word (unless you know the wiki "noformat" workaround)

This error is also reported in Confluence: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6007

Test:

m^3^ - m{^}3{^}.
CO~2~ - CO{~}2{~}.
fields.summary: Text formatting with wiki markup fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14067].
  {panel}

I just had a support customer who could not work out from our documentation how to increase perm gen space on Linux. We have had a few similar cases recently.

This is the page: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Increasing+JIRA+memory.

We need specific instructions on what exactly to do for perm gen. The current page is not specific enough. It assumes you have read through everything above and can then adapt what you have learnt for setting perm gen, which is asking a lot of customers. Also, if for example you are on Linux, most of the above doco you wade through is not relevant.

I think it could use a bit of a restructure and then more specific instructions.

Also it doesn't currently say where in setenv.sh or setenv.bat to add the line. It needs to.
fields.summary: Improve "Increasing JIRA Memory" page
support S/MIME for email communication in JIRA
Notification scheme can set "Previous Assignee" and "Current Assignee"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14039].
  {panel}

For workflow transitions, you can set Conditions, Validators and POST functions.
Only, what I miss as Conditions is the value of a certain field, such as Resolution.  I want to show a certain transition  (Pre-approve resolution) if the Resolution is Fix, but don't want to show it when it is e.g. User workaround.
Now I can only define user or subtask conditions.

For POST functions it is already possible to set a value for Resolution, which is very useful.
Can't it easily be done for Condition, too?
fields.summary: Ability to set field values as condition for workflow transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14024].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Create a new CVS module
#- set the timeout to *60000* seconds
#- (other fields have to be valid in order to test the CVS module)
# In the CVS modules screen, click Test

You will receive the following exception:
{noformat}
Error occurred while obtaining cvs or parsing the cvs log.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
	at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.waitFor(FutureTask.java:277)
	at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:127)
	at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.updateCvs(CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.java:336)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.vcs.RepositoryActionSupport.testRepository(RepositoryActionSupport.java:288)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.vcs.RepositoryTest.doExecute(RepositoryTest.java:68)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Testing CVS module throws IllegalArgumentException

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14015].
  {panel}

Since the 3.11, Time-tracking data can includes the issue's sub-tasks. This is a great long time expected feature. And I think we can make it even better.

Let's consider the following (I guess realistic in the way people uses Jira) scenario:

Most of the initial high level estimates are made on the Parent issue. 
Then as the issue understanding increases, estimated subtasks are created.

In order to keep the total estimated effort coherent between the Parent and its Children, the owner of a subtask must update the Parent according to the time tracking information passed in the children. For instance, if I initially estimate a Parent issue to 5 days of effort, if I then split it in 5 subtasks of 1 day, I can decide to reduce the remaining of the Parent issue in similar proportion (otherwise I'll get 10 days in the consolidated view). 

This should be an option - maybe I'll be pleased to keep a effort margin at the parent level "in case of".

Currently, this little process, while understood by our users, is quite cumbersome: update subtasks timetracking, than udpate parent timetracking.
It has a direct impact of the reliability of the information gathered at parent level.

We would like a shortcut in the subtask worklog screen that would allow the users to update the parent timetracking according to the children changes.
Sounds like a small change, but we do think it would increase the reliability of the time tracking data.
fields.summary: Add a "AutoAdjust Issue and Parent" option in the Worklog screen for subtasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14013].
  {panel}

USE CASE
often you want to attach stacktraces and other larger text files for tracking purposes that take up way too much space when added as an comment.
it also is mostly the case that you have the text in question in you clip board and not as a distinct file.

what you have to do now, is 
1. create a temp file with the content 
3. get the abs path of the file
2. upload it. 

=> way too many steps in my IMHO

WANTED
a similar function as for screenshots is desirable where you just can copy/past a text and then create the attachment file on the fly.
it would also be very convenient to spec the file type (ie endinf) and the mime type as also (at least i ) atach XML files/snippets often
fields.summary: [attachments] create text attachments on the fly with copy/paste and w/o uploading
Create a Jelly tag for modifying an existing custom field, particularly the available values (options)
Trackbacks between trusted apps
"nudge" function - add e-mail comment functionality
SOAP call to modify user attributes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13984].
  {panel}

User requested the following:

> within the group browser I can see, in which permission scheme a group is involved. If I delete a group, there is no warning that this group is used in a 
> permission scheme, the group will be removed and the group is automatically removed in the permission scheme(s), too. So far, ok, because the involved > permission schemes are listed.
> But if I want to delete a group, I need not only to know in which permission scheme this group is involved, but also in which
> 
>     * project (as a projectrole)
>     * issue security scheme
>     * notification scheme
>     * workflow (as a condition).
>  I have tried to delete a group, which is used in the above cases and the group was simply removed and every usage of this group was simply removed, 
> too without warning. And this behaviour is dangerous for our application.

>  So my question is, how can I find out all sites where a group is used, before deleting this group?
fields.summary: Add a warning and show all the associated schemes before deleting group from JIRA.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13981].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 29 October 2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,

Good news! We have addressed the original improvement request provided in the description of this issue, in JIRA 5.2. Users now have the ability to edit a workflow scheme on a project - a draft is created, and the migration is handled through the normal migration process. Functionality that has been provided:
* Add existing workflows
* Remove workflows from scheme
* Reassign issue types between workflows in the scheme
* Publish draft
* Discard draft

You can read all about the new improvements in the latest [JIRA EAP release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.2+EAP+4+(m6)+Release+Notes].

This functionality works if you have a 1:1 mapping between a project and a workflow scheme. I understand that this does not fulfil the functionality discussed in [JRA-5254], which is also mentioned in the comments on this issue. *We understand this and are actively addressing* [JRA-5254] - unfortunately it is not a part of JIRA 5.2.

Going forward, I will be resolving this issue when JIRA 5.2 is released in the coming weeks, and leaving [JRA-5254] open until that is fully addressed and workflow schemes can be edited when they are associated with more than one project.

If you have any questions or concerns feel free to contact me directly.

Thanks for your understanding,
Josh Devenny
JIRA Product Management
jdevenny at atlassian dot com
{panel}



Original Description
--------------------

So the current process is:
  1) Create a workflow with all steps etc
  2) Create workflow scheme, assigning issue types to workflows
  3) Configure project to use the new workflow
  4) Realise that you've forgotton something
  5) swear
  6) Copy Workflow - making required changes
  7) Copy workflow scheme
  8) Delete all assigned workflows in copied scheme
  9) Assign issue types to new workflows
  10) Configure project to use new workflow

.. And then there's the clean up stage where you delete the previous workflow scheme and workflow.

I've rarely seen changes to the workflow scheme once it's been configured, so it's just extra work to reconfigure the scheme for the new adjusted workflow.
fields.summary: Allow to edit an active workflow scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13980].
  {panel}

When using external authentication, it's possible to get into a state where multiple user entries exist for the same account.  This causes some difficult to diagnose problems, and leads to risky repairs.  Here's an example of a recent problem, for which it appears there are even explicit exceptions being raised in the code:

2007-11-16 02:36:34,885 http-123.123.123.123-443-Processor2 ERROR [web.action.issue.ViewIssue] Exception getting actions Found more than
one user with name 'Foo Bar'; ids
[GenericEntity:OSUser][passwordHash,blahblahblah][name,Foo Bar][id,12345], [GenericEntity:OSUser][passwordHash,null][name,Foo Bar][id,12346]

It would be extremely handy to have an integrity checker for the user table that would find potential duplicate user entries (and even better if it had a repair mode).
fields.summary: Integrity checker for user table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13960].
  {panel}

when viewing the sub tasks list of a specific issue
we need the ability to export those sub tasks to an excel file
the data in the excel file should be the same as when i export issues from the "find issues" menu,
this means that the output should be detailed and not only a representation of what we see on the screen.

a screenshot with an example sub tasks list is hereby attached
fields.summary: adding the ability to export sub tasks to an excel file
Quick "random password" button on create user page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13942].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

We are interested in bundling this functionality in JIRA by default, however I cannot provide an estimate when this will take place.

* For JIRA Server customers, you can install the free [OpenID Authentication plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.pawelniewiadomski.jira.jira-openid-authentication-plugin], maintained by one of our JIRA developers.
* In JIRA Cloud, authentication is managed across the entire Atlassian Cloud instance, we can consist of JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, and Bitbucket. Currently, we support Google Apps integration in Atlassian Cloud instances, however I cannot provide an estimate when we will have full OpenID support.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It would be useful for me to support openid authentication in Jira. I plan to build set of all web services based on openid authentication, so external users can use own openid server, and they do not need to register specifically with my Jira. 

OpenID would be similar to external LDAP - it only manages passwords. If Jira is in Public mode then new users may get some default user role (e.g. jira-users) after first log on, if Private then unknown OpenIDs should be just rejected.
fields.summary: OpenID support for authentication
Add option of "Reporter" on default assignee for the project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13917].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a filter with a custom field of columns.
2. Export the "Current Fields" to Excel and the right fields are shown.
3. Edit the filter WITHOUT saving (i.e. the red notice is on the left hand side)
4. Export the Current Fields to Excel again and the user default fields are shown in the list.

This might be intentional, but it's a bit unexpected.
fields.summary: Make export to Excel "Current Fields"  use filter's column order for modified filters
RPC DeleteUSer does not cleanup other user data
Allow single e-mail address notification to override security.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13885].
  {panel}

At the moment if the "Forward" parameter is not specified and an error occurs when processing an e-mail, the mail is left in the mail box, as JIRA is "too scared" to delete the message.

This causes problems if the error occurs after an issue or comment has been created, for example, when attachments are processed, as the issue or message will be created every time the service runs.

Therefore, it is recommended to set the Forward paremeter. For  more information see:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_creation_email.html

We need to find out how to deal with this case. Deleting a message feels like the wrong thing to do, as attachments could be important and were not processed correctly.

Ideas are welcome.
fields.summary: Prevent mail loop if JIRA fails to parse attachments of an e-mail message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13865].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

Currently, JIRA allows to create users with blank passwords; however, users for which the password is not set cannot log in - the system reports that the username/password is incorrect. This leads to the following problem.

If data is imported into JIRA from some other system (in our case it's TrackGear, via csv importer), users are created automatically, and passwords for them are not set. As a result, once import is complete, you may have hundreds of users in the database with no passwords - this means that they cannot login anyway until passwords for them are explicitly set. This is hundreds of manual password set operations used for one thing only - to let the user do his first login and then possibly change his password.

If the system either allowed users with blank passwords to login, or provided a bulk password set functionality, it would solve the problem.
fields.summary: Bulk password set
EditIssue using Jelly Tag
Description field doesn't escape the special character with XML syntax  in JELLY
Improve JIRA SOAP to allow for all schemes to be defined on new project creation
Document adding in-page template replies for JIRA comment field using GreaskMonkey
"Popular Issues" for a version should have totals
Launchpad-like External Issue Tracking
Remove case sensitivity from Group Names when searching

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13790].
  {panel}

I am a user of Jira because I use Jetbrain's Jira (3.10 Enterprise b#260). I only use Jetbrains's IDEA product, but they have many more products that are listed in Jira.

The problem I have with Quick Search is that it shows issues across all projects, it shows issues with all statuses.
Eventually I just got fed up with it and created a filter "IDEA Search Template" which has the projects, status, and resolution fields preset with a search term "ChangeThisXYZ". So, now what I do is click on "IDEA Search Template", then click Edit filter, then change the filter text, and then click View to see the jiras.

This got me thinking that maybe the Quick Search could just allow you to set a search filter as the default settings for the Quick Search. The Quick Search would use all the settings in the filter except for the query string. The query string would still be taken from the quick search textbox.
fields.summary: Quick Search should allow filter settings to be configurable.

fields.description: When you edit your comments, the comments edit dialog doesn't have any information reflecting back to what ticket you are editing.
fields.summary: Show issue information when editing a comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13776].
  {panel}

Scenario:
1. New issue created from an e-mail message (HTML) and image attachment added to the issue
2. above issue.is commented from the reply e-mail
Result: the images from original part of message are attached once again.

With long correspondence the amount of duplicated images becomes VERY big and is not good.
fields.summary: Duplicate attachments created from images inserted to HTML e-mails when comments added from follow-up messages
"Printable" icon only print the "first" tab view in the Edit Issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13768].
  {panel}

When we resolve an issue, we want the Assignee field to select the reporter by default, but allow the resolver to select another user.  Currently the Assignee field defaults to the currently assigned user, usually the resolver.  This is never the correct value for this field during a Resolve transition.

When we reopen an issue, we want the Assignee field to select the last assigned user.  I note there is already a request for this functionality.

Our plan is to install a Post Function that assigns the issue to the Reporter, and remove the Assignee field from the resolve screen.  This is less than ideal.   We have no simple solution for re-opened issues.

What I'd really like is some kind of pre-function that can alter values to be displayed on the web form without yet touching the underlying database.  Seems like this would allow for a wide variety of customizable transition behaviors and resolve a lot of bugs in this database.
fields.summary: Default values for fields during a transition
Provide text formatting capability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13763].
  {panel}

Hi,

please imagine the following scenario:

You create an issue with some subtasks in project A. Then you clone it with all subtasks and move the clone to project B. 

Some time later you create a new subtask for the issue in project A.  If you now want the new subtask in the clone too, then there's quite a lot to do because you can't move a subtask to another project.
What can be done is: clone the subtask. Convert it to a normal issue. Move it. Change to subtask. This ist quite a lot to do for such a simple action.

It would be really helpful to move subtask directly to another project because we need that very often.

Cheers and thx,
Irene
fields.summary: Allow to move subtask to parent in a different project
Adding or removing a user to/from the Watchers list of an issue should cause a change history entry

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13739].
  {panel}

Standard fields in predefined panels are grouped logically, not alphabetically.
Custom field cannot be organized the same way.

They go in alphabetical order (see screenshot) which is not convenient -
- *Closed User* field goes before *Resolution User*
- *Last ... Date* fields are in the middle of the panel, mixed closed and resolution dates together
- *Participants* are not where are want to see this field
fields.summary: Option to define order of custom fields in filter panel
Include a select all button or check box in custom fields' screens choosing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13730].
  {panel}

If one wants to configure JIRA with a POP3/IMAP mailbox first he needs to define the connection in Mail Servers providing (mailService.gif):
  	
- The name of this server within JIRA.	
- The host name of your POP / IMAP server.
- The username used to authenticate your POP / IMAP account.

and finally he needs to navigate to Services and specify if the communication is SSL or not (jiraService.gif). Where I believe this option is an integral part of the mail server configuration rather that the jira service.
fields.summary: POP3/IMAP server configuration should be done in one page
Version Workload and Time Tracking Reports should include options for showing Resolved/Unresolved and Complete/Incomplete issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13713].
  {panel}

Our Jira setup uses a separate Database Server (MySQL), over the past few weeks we have had several failures. In one the whole database became unavailable, and on two more occasions the database went read only (disk full, commits not possible).

While we obviously need to sort out the issues with the database uptime (and contractually it should be 100%, so we have a issue with the provider) we were also disappointed with Jira's behaviour during the outages. [please note: from my perspective as an admin, the logs etc.. were fine, messages were geeky but could be interpreted, and no corruption of the database has occurred].

Our end users, however, were confronted with error pages simply framed the Java exception (in all it's 'glory') no real attempt was made to clarify the situation to the user, just a very complex error message and a note to call the administrators.

In particular, when the dB was read-only, there was no problem viewing issues (which is good) but submitting issues only failed when the user had already entered all their data. Causing much irritation for some who had spent time entering detailed descriptions. Our only choices were to take Jira down altogether, or add a big red announcement banner (tm).

We appreciate that there is no easy technical fix for this, and that there will always be race conditions (Db goes down while user is editing etc..) that are hard to handle, but in situations where Jira relies on an potentially fallible external resource there is an opportunity to provide much more user-friendly error notification.
fields.summary: Better user feedback for database errors
Investigate the commonly occuring 'issue.search.util.LuceneQueryCreator' messages in the log files on jira.atlassian.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13707].
  {panel}

As far as I know Jira has 4 views:
1) All
2) Comments
3) Work History
4) Change History

When I print a Jira Issue it affords me only the information from the Comments view.  QA here would find it a time saver and paper saver to be able to print a combined view that includes Comments and Work History.  Selecting All or Change History are not options because in my workplace we have an extensive workflow which causes the All and Change History view to present many rows of data that are unimportant to us and a waste of paper when printing.
fields.summary: Printing - Allow users to combine the 'Comments' with 'Work Log' when viewing/printing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13698].
  {panel}

I get the following error when I try to recieve a response that should be formatted as a RemoteWorklog:

System.InvalidCastException was caught
  Message="Unable to cast object of type 'System.Xml.XmlNode[]' to type 'StarNet.Jira.Library.Jira.RemoteWorklog'."
  Source="StarNet.Jira.Library"
  StackTrace:
       at StarNet.Jira.Library.Jira.JiraSoapServiceService.addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimate(String in0, String in1, RemoteWorklog in2)
       at StarNet.Jira.Library.Service.AddWorkLogToIssue(String issueKey, RemoteWorklog workLog)

After closer analysis the main issue here is that the SOAP response has the following definition for the Worklog namespace:
xsi:type="ns3:IssueServiceImpl$RemoteWorklogImpl"
But in .Net the '$' character is not valid in xsi type descriptions.

To get around this I have re-written the RPC for our live server to return a Long value as the RemoteWorklog.id.
This is generally more practiacl anyway, though I would really like to get the whole object for the sake continuity as I cannot be sure how the Service will modify the Worklog after updates.

I have attached the diff file for anyone interested in similar functionality. (there are a few other features in this diff file for your pleasure also!)
*Please Note that these changes will break the standard test scripts.

further structural issues:
RemoteWorklog object has readonly properties, this doesn't directly affect how the object is comsumed at the client end but with a severe lack of documentation it is impossible to know which fields are expected to be changed when the object is passed as a parameter to the Soap Service.
fields.summary: RemoteWorklog doesn not deserialize in .Net

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13694].
  {panel}

The current RSS support limits the fields that you can export.  It is after all only intended to provide users with an RSS view of the issues.  However, it would be useful if the existing XML link would allow you to get a comprehensive dump of the currently visible issues in XML, and select an XSLT transform to be applied to the XML.  The use case would be something like this:

(1) User opens the issue navigator, performs appropriate filtering, then clicks the XML link.
(2) Popup appears allowing the user to select from one of the registered XSLTs. 
(3) The selected transform is then applied to XML.

The default XSLTs might include GanttProject, and MS Project XML file formats.

Making it pluggable makes it possible for administrators to add their own XSLTs to support additional export formats.  These might include transforms that take JIRA issues and generate requirements documentation in XHTML or other formats.
fields.summary: Allow Pluggable XSLT support in XML Export
Import from trac
Cannot use unclosed variable text "${" in Jelly scripts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13681].
  {panel}

I would like the project select list to always default to NO value at the creation of issue. I want that the user choose systematiccally the project for which he want to create an issue.

In my case, at the 1st connexion to JIRA in the morning, the default project select in the list, for an issue creation,  is the 1st one in the list occured a lot of problem. This first project receives a lot of issues not for him.

Thank to implement this issue as soon as possible. I know how many issues you have, and how many are very urgent, but this one is very urgent for us.
Cheers
fields.summary: Allow to have no project selected by default during create an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13680].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA does not support a "Lead" status within a Group. This is weird because when an issue gets to a certain state, it often has to be auto-assigned the The Guy In Charge first who will decide what to do next. (E.g. if an issue gets to "To Be Regressed", it should be assigned to QA Lead first (automatically), and then reassigned by the lead to a particular resource.)

What would be nice to have from this standpoint is: 

- Capability to define a "Default Member" / "Lead" of a Group 
- A post-function to auto-assign issue to a Lead of specified Group (selected from a dropdown list) 

The "Assign to Group" plugin does not qualify because it requires explicitly specifying the Group Lead in transition properties which's a maintenance problem. Defining users and groups must be located entirely in User Management section, else evey time a group lead is hired/fired, the admin would have to swicth workflows (which may take up to hours if the databse is big enough) and modify every certain transition to change the user defined there.
fields.summary: Enable auto-assigning to Group Lead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13676].
  {panel}

The subscriptions functionality is great, but it's really hard to get a handle on what subscriptions I currently have.

The list of filters in the 'Manage' screen of the Issue Navigator gets to be enormous once a few shared filters are there, and it's difficult to scroll through and find the ones I'm subscribed to.

It would be great to either:

- have a list of subscribed filters separate to 'Viewable filters' on the 'Manage' screen of the Issue Navigator
- have a list of subscriptions under my profile.

Implementing both would be super.
fields.summary: Screen which shows summary of subscriptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13672].
  {panel}

Currently the default using of "Porter" stemming means that certain search phrases do not return results that the user might expect.

For example if the issue summary is "Moose problems" then the default stemming will cause "moos" to be stored in the index.

If the user then enters a search request for "Moose" then no match will be made.  The reason is that the Lucene QueryParser code does NOT perform analysis on "Prefix" queries by default.

Hence a PrefixQuery for the term "moose" is submitted and the index doent contain this terms and hence no issue is returned.

The improvement would be to tweak QueryParser so that it does perform "analysis" on prefix queries.  So the term "moose" would be stemmed to "moos" and then the Prefix Query would return the expected results.
fields.summary: Better searching when stemming is in place.  Improve  Lucene QueryParser to perform analysis on prefixed queries.
Make field required per issue status
PermissionsParameter should optimize the way it builds the Issue Security Level permission checks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13659].
  {panel}

When an issue is moved between projects, the original issue key is left unassigned, it is never reused, and exists solely as a searchable item pointing to the new issue key. 
If the issue is subsequently moved back to the original project it is then assigned a new issue key in the project. 
It would make more sense if the original issue key was reassigned to the issue.
* Recently we needed to 'undo' an incorrect move, and users subsequently queried why the number had changed.
fields.summary: Moving an issue back to a previous project SHOULD re-use the 'old' issue key
